fields.value: What Do the Leading Indicators Lead?

authorAffiliation.value: University of California at San Diego
University of California at San Diego

dsDescriptionValue.value: The authors find that the composite leading index (CLI) is  useful for forecasting gross national product (GNP), both in a sample  and an out-of-sample real-time exercise. They propose a nonlinear  specification in which cyclical shifts of the CLI precede those in  GNP. However, the authors find that better forecasts are provided by a  simple linear relation between current GNP growth along with an  error-correction term corresponding to the previous quarter's  logarithmic difference between the level of the CLI and the level of GNP.
